ground spike on the exterior of the licensed premises that advertises or
displays or indicates the presence or availability of cigarettes, tobacco,
tobacco products, alternative nicotine products, electronic cigarettes, or
nicotine containing products (e.g. Vape Pens) within the licensed premises,
provided such banner is either a feather flag style banner or a rectangle flag
style banner or a teardrop flag style banner, not to exceed in any case a width
of two feet (2') and an overall height of eight feet (8') from the ground
level.
   B.   A licensee is permitted to locate and maintain one sign, not to exceed
twenty-four inches (24") by thirty inches (30") in size, affixed on the
exterior of the licensed premises that advertises or displays or indicates the
presence or availability of, alternative nicotine products, electronic
cigarettes, or nicotine containing products (e.g. Vape Pens) within the
licensed premises.
   C.   A licensee is permitted to locate and maintain one sign, not to exceed
twenty-four inches (24") by thirty inches (30") in size, affixed in the
interior of the licensed premises where such signage is visible to persons
outside the licensed premises that advertises or displays or indicates the
presence or availability of cigarettes, tobacco, tobacco products, alternative
nicotine products, electronic cigarettes, or nicotine containing products (e.g.
Vape Pens) within the licensed premises.
   D.   Except as otherwise permitted in the preceding subparagraphs 1, 2, and
3, it shall be unlawful for any person or licensee to place, locate, or
maintain any flag, banner, signage or any other device or structure of any
kind, nature or extent whatsoever that advertises or displays or indicates the
presence or availability of cigarettes, tobacco, tobacco products, alternative
nicotine products, electronic cigarettes, or nicotine containing products (e.g.
Vape Pens)within the licensed premises on or about the exterior of the licensed
premises and/or in the interior of the licensed premises such that it is
visible to persons outside the licensed premises and/or on any adjoining
property.
   E.   It shall be unlawful for any person or licensee to place, locate, or
maintain any signage or banner or any device or structure of any kind, nature
or extent whatsoever on City property or on any City right-of-way or on any
City boulevard or on any City street, roadway or alleyway that advertises or
displays or indicates the presence or availability of cigarettes, tobacco,
tobacco products, alternative nicotine products, electronic cigarettes, or
nicotine containing products (e.g. Vape Pens). (Ord. 4210, 11-20-2023; amd.
Ord. 4228, 2-21-2024)
3-6-5: SANITARY REQUIREMENTS:
Premises and buildings used for the sale of cigarettes or tobacco shall be kept
in a clean and sanitary condition. The health and building officer shall
investigate such places sufficiently often to ensure compliance with this
section. (Ord. 2543, 5-2-1994)
3-6-6: SALES OR GIFTS TO OR CONSUMPTION OR POSSESSION BY PERSONS UNDER AGE
TWENTY-ONE YEARS:
   A.   It shall be unlawful to sell or to give or furnish any cigarette,
tobacco, tobacco product, alternative nicotine product, electronic cigarette,
or nicotine containing product (e.g. vape pen) in any form to any person under
twenty-one (21) years of age; provided, however, a parent or judicially
established legal guardian of such person under twenty-one (21) years of age
may give or furnish such person any cigarette, tobacco, tobacco product,
alternative nicotine product, electronic cigarette, or nicotine containing
product (e.g. vape pen), provided same is solely consumed in the privacy of the
residential home of such parent or guardian.
   B.   It shall be unlawful for any person under twenty-one years (21) years
of age to consume or possess any cigarette, tobacco, tobacco product,
alternative nicotine product, electronic cigarette, or nicotine containing
product (e.g. vape pen) in any form except in the privacy of the residential
home of a parent or judicially established legal guardian of such person.
   C.   Any person violating any of the provisions of this Section
3-3-6 shall be fined seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for the first
offense, and a sum of seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each subsequent
offense. Each sale or gift or act of furnishing upon which a violation occurs
or continues shall be deemed to be a separate offense. Each day of consumption
or possession upon which a violation occurs or continues shall be deemed to be
a separate offense.
   D.   Any cigarette and tobacco licensee who, individually or through such
licensee's employee, agent, or representative, violates any of the provisions
of this Section
3-3-6 shall be fined seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for the first
offense and the sum of seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each
subsequent offense; and, in addition to such fine, for the second such offense
the license of said cigarette and tobacco licensee shall also be suspended for
a ninety (90) consecutive day period or for the remaining period of the
applicable license year, whichever date is the longest; and, in addition to
such fine, for a third such offense the license of said cigarette and tobacco
licensee shall be permanently terminated and shall not be subject to renewal or
reinstatement at any time in the future. Each sale or gift or act of furnishing
upon which a violation occurs or continues shall be deemed to be a separate
offense. (Ord. 2940, 1-18-2000; amd. Ord. 3523, 7-18-2011; Ord. 4209, 11-20-
2023; Ord. 4276, 11-4-2024)
3-6-7: PENALTY:
Except for the penalties as otherwise provided in subsection E of section
3-6-3 and in subsections C and D of section
3-6-6 of this
Chapter 6, any person violating any provision of this
Chapter 6 shall, for each offense, be fined and punished as provided in Section
1-4-1 of this City Code. Each day upon which a violation occurs or continues
shall be deemed a separate offense. (Ord. 2940, 1-18-2000; amd. Ord. 4239, 4-
15-2024; Ord. 4276, 11-4-2024)
ARTICLE A. ALTERNATIVE NICOTINE PRODUCTS
(Rep. by Ord. 3939, 1-6-2020)
CHAPTER 7
PEDDLERS, TRANSIENT MERCHANTS, AND ITINERANT VENDORS
SECTION:
3-7-1: Definitions
3-7-2: License Requirements; Prohibitions
3-7-3: Application For Peddler License
3-7-4: Application For Transient Merchant's Or Itinerant Vendor's License And
Regulations
3-7-5: Fees For And Term Of License
3-7-6: Display Of License
3-7-7: Revocation Of License
3-7-8: Holding Inventory
3-7-9: Receipts For The Purchase Of New And Unused Property
3-7-10: Compliance With City Zoning Code
3-7-11: Penalty
3-7-1: DEFINITIONS:
   CITY: The city of Taylorville, in Christian County, Illinois.
   FLEA MARKET: Any location, other than a permanent retail store, at which
space is rented or otherwise made available to others for conduct of business
as a transient merchant or itinerant vendor.
   ITINERANT VENDOR: Any person who transports tangible personal property for
retail sale within the city and who does not maintain in the city an
established office, distribution house, sales house, warehouse, service center,
or residence from which such business is conducted. It shall be prima facie
evidence that a person is an itinerant vendor if the person does not transact
business from a fixed location or if the person does not own, or lease for a
term of at least six (6) months, the property from which business is conducted.
However, the term itinerant vendor shall not include any of the following
persons:
   A.   Any person who delivers tangible personal property within the city who
is fulfilling an order for such property which was solicited or placed by mail,
phone, fax, e-mail, or other similar communication means.
   B.   A peddler.
   NEW AND UNUSED PROPERTY: Tangible property that is acquired in the ordinary
course of business by the unused property merchant directly from the producer,
manufacturer, wholesaler, or retailer, that: a) has not been used since its
production or manufacture or b) is in its original and unopened package when
originally produced or manufactured.
   PEDDLER: Any person who is engaged in the retail or wholesale sale of goods,
wares, merchandise, services, or real or personal property of any kind, nature,
or extent whatsoever or who is engaged in soliciting funds or contributions and
who, for the purpose of conducting any such business, travels on foot or in any
vehicle from house to house or from place to place within the city or on city
owned property. However, the term peddler shall not include any of the
following persons:
   A.   Farmers, fruit growers and gardeners who sell the produce of their
farm, orchard or vineyard.
   B.   Persons who make sales presentations pursuant to and after making
previously scheduled appointment(s) or arrangement(s) with the owner or legal
occupant of the premises.
   C.   Sellers or deliverers of newspapers.
   D.   Persons, who without receiving any compensation for their services,
sell or solicit for any civic, patriotic, fraternal, educational, religious or
benevolent organizations, provided such organization is recognized as a tax
exempt organization under the federal internal revenue service laws, rules, and
regulations.
   E.   Any political candidate and/or persons, who solicit support, ideas,
votes, or political financial contributions for any political candidate.
   F.   Persons who are not engaged in the sale of any goods, wares, or
merchandise or to solicit funds or financial contributions but solely convey or
solicit ideas to or from any owner or occupant of property.
   G.   Any person who conveys religious messages or ideas or doorstep
proselytizing to the owner(s) or occupant(s) of any property.
   PERSON: Any individual, corporation, partnership, trust, firm, association,
or other entity.
   TRANSIENT MERCHANT: Any person who is engaged temporarily in the retail sale
of goods, wares, or merchandise in the city and who, for the purpose of
conducting such business occupies any building, room, vehicle, structure of any
kind, or vacant lot. It shall be prima facie evidence that a person is a
transient merchant if the person does not transact business from a fixed
location or if the person does not own, or lease for a term of at least six (6)
months, the property from which business is conducted. However, the term
transient merchant shall not include any of the following persons:
   A.   Any person selling goods, wares, or merchandise which are raised,
produced, or manufactured by him or her.
   B.   Any person selling vegetables, fruits, or perishable farm products at
an established city market.
   C.   Any person operating a stand or booth on or adjacent to property owned
by him or her or upon which he or she resides.
   D.   Any person operating a stand or booth at a trade show, exposition,
convention or similar event.
   E.   Any person selling any goods, wares or merchandise at a special event
sponsored by any recognized not for profit charitable, civic, patriotic,
fraternal, educational, or religious organization. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
3-7-2: LICENSE REQUIREMENTS; PROHIBITIONS:
   A.   License Required: It is unlawful for any person, either as principal or
agent, to conduct business as a peddler or transient merchant or itinerant
vendor within the city, without first complying with the requirements of
section 2 of the retailer's occupation tax act 1  by obtaining a certificate of
registration and without first having obtained the appropriate license from the
city's police department under this chapter.
   B.   Certain Items Prohibited: No license shall be issued to any peddler,
transient merchant, or itinerant vendor to engage in business involving any
meats, fish or poultry of any kind, nature, or extent whatsoever unless such
peddler, transient merchant, or itinerant vendor possesses the necessary and
current licenses or permits from all federal, state, or local regulatory
agencies having jurisdiction over the handling, sale, or delivery of such
items. It is unlawful for any peddler, transient merchant, or itinerant vendor
to engage in any business involving any meats, fish, or poultry of any kind,
nature, or extent whatsoever within the city without the necessary licenses or
permits from all such federal, state, or local regulatory agencies.
   C.   Distance From Playground Or School Property: It is unlawful for any
licensee while engaged in business activities of a peddler, transient merchant,
or itinerant vendor to park any vehicle or stand within two hundred feet (200')
of any playground or school property during the time that organized
recreational or school activities are in progress or in session.
   D.   Hours Of Operation:
      1.   It is unlawful for a peddler to engage in the business of a peddler
within the city prior to nine o'clock (9:00) A.M. or after six o'clock (6:00)
P.M. on any day, or at any time on any Sunday; and
      2.   It is unlawful for a transient merchant to engage in the business of
a transient merchant prior to nine o'clock (9:00) A.M. or after eight o'clock
(8:00) P.M. on any day; and
      3.   It is unlawful for an itinerant vendor to engage in the business of
an itinerant vendor prior to nine o'clock (9:00) A.M. or after eight o'clock
(8:00) P.M. on any day.
   E.   Compliance With Signs Posted: It is unlawful for any peddler to engage
in business of a peddler at any residence within the city where there is
displayed upon or near the entrance of such residence a sign or notice which
has words thereon indicating solicitors or peddlers are not wanted or invited,
such as: "NO SOLICITORS INVITED" or "NO PEDDLERS INVITED" or words to the same
effect.
   F.   Request To Leave: It is unlawful for a peddler to remain at any
residence or place within the city after being asked by an owner or legal
occupant of such residence or place to leave.
   G.   Business On City Owned Or Residential Property: It is unlawful for a
peddler, transient merchant, or itinerant vendor to engage in the business of a
peddler, transient merchant, or itinerant vendor from any stationary vehicle on
any city owned property or from any stationary vehicle that is located on any
property zoned with a residential classification under the city's zoning code.
   H.   Transient Merchants Restricted: It is unlawful for a transient merchant
to conduct any business activities of a transient merchant on any city owned
property or on any property within the city that has a residential zoning
classification under the city's zoning code.
   I.   Prohibited Products: It is unlawful for any transient merchant or
itinerant vendor at a flea market to sell, offer for sale, or knowingly permit
the sale of baby food, infant formula, or similar products, or any
pharmaceuticals, over the counter drugs, cosmetics, or medical devices. This
subsection does not apply to a person who keeps available for public inspection
an identification card identifying him or her as an authorized representative
of the manufacturer or distributor of any pharmaceuticals, over the counter
drugs, cosmetics, or medical devices, as long as such card is not false,
fraudulent, or fraudulently obtained.
   J.   Locations Restricted: It is unlawful for any peddler or transient
merchant or itinerant vendor to engage in any business activity at any location
that is not identified and authorized in the applicable peddler's license or
transient merchant's license or itinerant vendor's license issued under this
chapter.
   K.   Bond Requirement: The city waives any requirement of posting a surety
bond or cash deposit by any applicant for a peddler's license or a transient
merchant's license or an itinerant vendor's license. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
 
Notes
1 1. 35 ILCS 120/2.
3-7-3: APPLICATION FOR PEDDLER LICENSE:
Any person who wishes to obtain a license as a peddler shall file a written
license application with the city's police department on a form approved by the
city's police chief from time to time, and such application shall set forth the
following information and the applicant shall provide the following documents:
   A.   The applicant's name, permanent business address (which must include a
street address), and phone number and residence address and phone number of the
principal (and, if the applicant is a corporation, the residence address and
phone numbers of its officers). The names, addresses and telephone numbers of
all persons who will engage in the business pursuant to the license to be
granted.
   B.   The nature of the business the applicant intends to conduct and a
description of the goods, wares, merchandise, services, and property intended
to be sold or solicited under the issued license.
   C.   The specific dates, days of the week, and times during which such
business is desired to be conducted under the issued license. No one peddler
license shall be issued for any longer period than twenty five (25) days within
a thirty (30) consecutive day period. Any subsequent written application(s) by
the same peddler for another peddler license must be submitted with the
requisite fees and be in compliance with this section.
   D.   The current name, business address, and telephone numbers of the
applicant's employer or contractor, if any.
   E.   For all peddlers who intend to sell tangible personal property, a copy
of the applicant's certificate of registration under the retailer's occupation
tax act 1  and the applicant's state business registration number issued by the
Illinois state department of revenue; and all other evidence to the
satisfaction of the city's police department that sales of tangible personal
property made within the city will be reported as taxable sales within the city
to the Illinois state department of revenue.
   F.   Current photo identification of the applicant and for each person who
will be engaged in the business under the license to be granted.
   G.   The license plate number, model, make, year, and color of any vehicle
that will be used while engaged in business. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
   H.   During the application process and prior to the issuance of the
license, a background check will be completed on all applicants. During this
process if it is determined an applicant has a criminal record, it will be
reviewed by the chief of police or his designee to determine if a license will
be issued to that applicant. (Ord. 3525, 7-18-2011)
 
Notes
1 1. 35 ILCS 120/1 et seq.
3-7-4: APPLICATION FOR TRANSIENT MERCHANT'S OR ITINERANT VENDOR'S LICENSE AND
REGULATIONS:
Any person who wishes to obtain a license as a transient merchant or itinerant
vendor shall file a written license application with the city's police
department on a form approved by the city's police chief from time to time, and
such application shall set forth the following information and the applicant
shall provide the following documents:
   A.   The applicant's name, permanent business address (which must include a
street address), and phone number and residence address and phone number of the
principal (and, if the applicant is a corporation, the residence address and
phone numbers of its officers).
   B.   The location in the city at which the applicant intends to do business
and the specific dates, days of the week, and times during which such business
will be conducted. In the case of a transient merchant, the application shall
also include the specific location and address in the city from which the
business of a transient merchant will be conducted during the transient
merchant license period applied for and shall identify the legal names of all
owners of such location from which the business of a transient merchant will be
conducted. Such applicant shall further submit a written lease or other written
evidence of the applicant's authorization to conduct the business of a
transient merchant upon such property during all such times applied for.
   C.   The nature of the business the applicant intends to conduct.
   D.   For all transient merchants or itinerant vendors who intend to sell
tangible personal property within the city, copy of the applicant's certificate
of registration under the retailer's occupation tax act 1  and the applicant's
state business registration number issued by the Illinois state department of
revenue; and all other evidence to the satisfaction of the city's police
department that sales of tangible personal property made within the city will
be reported as taxable sales within the city to the Illinois state department
of revenue. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
All transient merchants and itinerant vendors shall provide a list of products
that will be sold and the prices at which each product will be sold at the time
application for a license is sought. In addition, all transient merchants and
itinerant vendors shall clearly display a list of products that they will be
selling and the prices at which each product will be sold on said merchants'/
vendors' unit/equipment used in the sale of said products while selling to the
public. It is the intent of this subsection that the list of products and the
price at which each product will be sold will be clearly visible to the public
so that the public will know the price of each product prior to purchase. (Ord.
3248, 9-19-2005)
   E.   A complete inventory of the goods the applicant intends to offer for
sale.
   F.   A list of all licenses to conduct business as a transient merchant or
an itinerant vendor obtained by the applicant in the state of Illinois in the
twelve (12) months preceding the date of filing of the application.
   G.   Current photo identification of the applicant and for each person who
will be engaged in the business under the license to be granted.
   H.   The license plate number, model, make, year, and color of any vehicle
that will be used while engaged in business. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
   I.   The following regulations shall apply to all itinerant vendors within
the city of Taylorville, Illinois:
      1.   An itinerant vendor may only operate at a location which has been
approved by the Taylorville city council.
      2.   Any equipment used by an itinerant vendor shall be maintained in a
manner acceptable by the Christian County health department.
      3.   An itinerant vendor which requires power (electricity) shall have
his own power source unless otherwise waived or permitted by the Taylorville
city council.
      4.   An itinerant vendor's unit/equipment shall display the owner's name
which shall be affixed to the unit/equipment in a manner that is clearly
visible to the public.
      5.   An itinerant vendor who has cooking apparatus on their unit/
equipment shall have a fully charged fire extinguisher accessible to the
operator.
      6.   An itinerant vendor shall have litter receptacles which are
available for customer use if the itinerant vendor offers food and/or beverages
for sale.
      7.   Itinerant vendors shall not:
         a.   Discharge fat or other waste into the city's storm sewer;
         b.   Leave the itinerant vendor's unit/equipment unattended;
         c.   Leave a location without disposing of all litter;
         d.   Solicit or conduct business with persons in motor vehicles;
         e.   Operate within three hundred feet (300') of another itinerant
vendor unless permitted by the Taylorville city council;
         f.   Operate within five hundred feet (500') of a public school
property unless permitted by the Taylorville city council;
         g.   Operate within fifty feet (50') of an intersection unless
otherwise permitted by the Taylorville city council;
         h.   Operate on any city street where the speed limit exceeds thirty
(30) miles per hour unless otherwise permitted by the Taylorville city council;
         i.   Operate within fifty feet (50') of any other business that sells
food or beverages unless otherwise permitted by the Taylorville city council;
         j.   Provide tables or seating for customers unless otherwise
permitted by the Taylorville city council;
         k.   Block any street, alley, or lane of traffic unless otherwise
permitted by the Taylorville city council;
      8.   Failure on the part of an itinerant vendor to comply with the
provisions of this subsection I may result in the revocation of the vendor's
license. (Ord. 3248, 9-19-2005)
   J.   During the application process and prior to the issuance of the
license, a background check will be completed on all applicants. During this
process if it is determined an applicant has a criminal record, it will be
reviewed by the chief of police or his designee to determine if a license will
be issued to that applicant. (Ord. 3525, 7-18-2011)
 
Notes
1 1. 35 ILCS 120/1 et seq.
3-7-5: FEES FOR AND TERM OF LICENSE:
   A.   At the time of submittal of the application, the applicant for a
transient merchant license or an itinerant vendor license shall pay to the
city's police department in advance a fee of twenty five dollars ($25.00) per
day within the city; provided, however, if the license application requests a
period of four (4) days or more in the same calendar year, then such license
fee shall be a total of one hundred dollars ($100.00) for such calendar year.
Any such license shall expire on December 31 of the calendar year it was
issued. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
   B.   Pursuant to 215 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/415, the aforesaid twenty
five dollar ($25.00) per day per person fees for a peddler's license shall not
apply to insurance salesmen or agents who are employed by or are an agent of an
insurance company legally authorized to conduct business in Illinois and
provided such insurance company is subject to the fees, charges, and taxes
provided for under the Illinois insurance code. However, such insurance
salesmen or agents whose business activities include that of a "peddler", as
defined in this chapter, shall apply for and obtain a peddler's license in
accordance with this chapter prior to engaging in such business within the
city. (Ord. 3222, 4-4-2005)
   C.   All such fees collected by the city's police department shall be
delivered to the city's treasurer for the general account of the city. (Ord.
3093, 9-3-2002)
3-7-6: DISPLAY OF LICENSE:
A licensee shall have the license issued under this chapter in the licensee's
personal possession while in the city conducting business under such issued
license; and a licensee shall immediately show such issued license to any and
all persons contacted by the licensee, and to any and all city law enforcement
officers who request, from time to time, to see such issued license. (Ord.
3093, 9-3-2002)
3-7-7: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
   A.   At his or her sole discretion, the chief of police and/or his or her
designee may revoke the license issued by the city's police department to any
peddler or transient merchant or itinerant vendor under any of the following
circumstances:
      1.   After review of any one or more complaints regarding the adverse
behavior of any licensee, or any of the licensee's employees or agents, towards
any person(s); or if any licensee, or any of the licensee's employees or
agents, engages in any unethical practices while engaging in any business
activities.
      2.   If any licensee, or any of the licensee's employees or agents,
provides any false or misleading information to any person(s) while engaging in
any business activities.
      3.   If two (2) or more complaints are received on the behavior of any
one or more licensed persons engaged in business for the same person.
   B.   The city's police chief shall revoke the license of any licensee under
any of the following circumstances:
      1.   If it is determined that the licensee made any false material
statement in the licensee's application for a license.
      2.   If the licensee, or any of the employees or agents of the licensee,
violates any of the provisions of this chapter.
      3.   If the aforesaid state business registration number issued by the
Illinois state department of revenue to the licensee is revoked or suspended.
   C.   If a license is revoked, then such person whose license was revoked
shall not be entitled to apply for another license for a period of three
hundred sixty five (365) days from the date of such revocation. (Ord. 3093, 9-
3-2002)
3-7-8: HOLDING INVENTORY:
   A.   If any person makes retail sales as a peddler or transient merchant or
itinerant vendor without having obtained a license under this chapter, the
city's police department may hold the inventory, truck or other personal
property of the person until such person obtains a license under this chapter
to conduct business as a peddler or as a transient merchant or itinerant vendor
in the city. If the property has been held by the city's police department for
more than sixty (60) days and the person whose property is being held has not
obtained a license under this chapter, the city's police department or the city
may petition the circuit court in the city for an order for the sale of the
property being held. If the circuit court finds that the person whose property
is held has not obtained a license under this chapter, the circuit court may
order the city's police department or the city to sell the property. Proceeds
of the sale of the property, less reimbursement to the city's police department
of the reasonable expenses of storage and sale of the property, shall be
deposited with the city treasurer. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
3-7-9: RECEIPTS FOR THE PURCHASE OF NEW AND UNUSED PROPERTY:
   A.   An unused property merchant must maintain receipts for the purchase of
new and unused property purchased or acquired on or after the effective date of
the enactment of this chapter. The receipts must contain the following
information:
      1.   The date of the transaction;
      2.   The name and address of the person, corporation, or entity from whom
the new and unused property was acquired;
      3.   An identification and description of the new and unused property
acquired;
      4.   The price paid for the new and unused property; and
      5.   The signature of the seller and buyer of the new and unused
property.
   B.   It is a violation of this section for an unused property merchant
required to maintain receipts under the provisions of this section to
knowingly:
      1.   Falsify, obliterate, or destroy the receipts;
      2.   Refuse or fail to make the receipts available for inspection upon
request within a period of time that is reasonable under the individual
circumstances surrounding the request; however, the unused property merchant is
not required to possess the receipt on or about his or her person without
reasonable notice; or
      3.   Fail to maintain the receipts required by this section for at least
two (2) years.
   C.   The provisions of this section shall not apply to the following:
      1.   The sale of a motor vehicle or trailer that is required to be
registered or is subject to the certificate of title laws of the state of
Illinois;
      2.   The sale of livestock, ice, or wood for fuel;
      3.   Business conducted in any industry or association trade show;
      4.   Property, although never used, whose style, packaging, or material
clearly indicates that the property was not produced or manufactured recently;
      5.   A person who sells by sample, catalog, or brochure for future
delivery;
      6.   The sale of arts or crafts or other merchandise by the person who
produced those arts or crafts or other merchandise or by a person or persons
acting on his or her behalf; or
      7.   A person who makes sales presentations pursuant to a prior,
individualized invitation issued to the consumer by the owner or legal occupant
of the premises. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
3-7-10: COMPLIANCE WITH CITY ZONING CODE:
The fact that any person may be determined exempt from this chapter does not
authorize such person to conduct any business or activities at any location
within the city where it is prohibited under the city's then existing zoning
code. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
3-7-11: PENALTY:
Any person violating any provision(s) of this chapter shall, for each offense,
be punished and/or fined as provided in section
1-4-1 of this code; and a separate offense shall be deemed to occur on each day
any such violation occurs or continues. (Ord. 3093, 9-3-2002)
CHAPTER 8
PAWNBROKERS
SECTION:
3-8-1: License And Compliance Required
3-8-2: Application For License; Investigation; Fee
3-8-3: Records Kept
3-8-4: Stolen Goods
3-8-5: Revocation Of License
3-8-6: Penalty
3-8-1: LICENSE AND COMPLIANCE REQUIRED:
No person shall conduct or operate the business of pawnbroker without having
first secured a license therefor as is herein provided or in violation of any
of the provisions herein contained. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. III, § 1)
3-8-2: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; INVESTIGATION; FEE:
Applications for pawnbrokers' licenses shall be made to the City Clerk and
shall state thereon the name of the applicant, the place of business, the
number of employees intended to be engaged, and whether or not the applicant
intends to sell, purchase, trade, or engage in the pawning of firearms and/or
ammunition; and, if so, a certified copy of the applicant's Federal license,
issued by the Federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms authorizing such
applicant to engage in the sale, purchase, trade, or pawning of firearms and/or
ammunition, shall be attached to such application. The Chief of Police or any
other officer of the City designated by the Council shall investigate each
applicant for such license and shall report back whether or not such applicant
is a person of good character. No license shall be issued to a person who has
been convicted of the offense of receiving stolen goods or of burglary or
robbery; and no license shall be issued to any applicant for the sale,
purchase, trade, or pawning of firearms and/or ammunition without having the
aforesaid Federal license; and any such license once issued shall be subject to
immediate revocation by the Mayor upon termination, suspension, or revocation
of said Federal license. The annual fee to be paid for a pawnbroker's license
shall be seventy five dollars ($75.00). (Ord. 2764, 9-3-1996)
3-8-3: RECORDS KEPT:
Every pawnbroker doing business in the City shall keep a record of every
article pledged with him or sold to him, and this record shall be open to the
inspection of any police officer at any time during business hours. (1979 Code
Ch. 14, Art. III, § 4)
3-8-4: STOLEN GOODS:
It shall be the duty of every pawnbroker to report to the police any article
pledged with him, or which it is sought to pledge with him, if he shall have
reason to believe that the article was stolen or lost and found by the person
attempting to pledge it in the case of a lost article. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art.
III, § 5)
3-8-5: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
Any pawnbroker's license may be revoked by the Mayor and Council for any
violation of any provision of this Chapter. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. III, § 1)
3-8-6: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the provisions of this Chapter shall, for each
offense, be punished as provided in Section
1-4-1 of this Code. (1993 Code)
CHAPTER 9
AUTOMOBILE SALVAGE YARDS 1
SECTION:
3-9-1: Definition
3-9-2: Permit Required
3-9-3: Application for Permit; Fee; Nontransferability
3-9-4: Conditions of Permit
3-9-5: Fences and Advertisements
3-9-6: Sanitary and Safety Requirements
3-9-7: Inspections
3-9-8: Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. See Chapter 10 of this Title for junk yards.
3-9-1: DEFINITION:
As used in this Chapter, the term "automobile salvage" shall mean any lot or
place which is exposed to the weather, upon which more than five (5) motor
vehicles of any kind, incapable of being operated, are placed. (Ord. 2277, 3-7-
88)
3-9-2: PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person shall maintain or operate an automobile salvage yard without first
having obtained a permit therefor. (Ord. 2277, 3-7-88)
3-9-3: APPLICATION FOR PERMIT; FEE; NONTRANSFERABILITY:
Application for a permit shall be made to the City Clerk and shall contain the
name and address of the applicant and the location of the premises where the
business is to be carried on. A fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be
charged, and the permit is not transferable. (Ord. 2277, 3-7-88)
3-9-4: CONDITIONS OF PERMIT:
   A.   Hours:
      1.   Demolishing and Wrecking Cars: Work in connection with the
demolishing or wrecking of cars shall be permitted only on weekdays and
Saturdays between the hours of seven o'clock (7:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00)
P.M.
      2.   Purchases by Operator: No purchaser operating or maintaining an
automobile salvage yard shall purchase any vehicles, or parts or accessories
thereof, except between the hours of sunrise and ten o'clock (10:00) P.M.
   B.   Vehicles Without Identification Marks: No purchaser shall knowingly
buy, sell, receive, dispose of, conceal or have in his possession any motor
vehicle, part or accessory from which the manufacturer's serial number or any
other number or identification mark has been removed, defaced, covered, altered
or destroyed for the purpose of concealing or misrepresenting the identity of
the vehicle, part or accessory. Every person to whom is offered for sale any
motor vehicle, part or accessory from which has been removed, defaced, covered,
altered or destroyed the manufacturer's serial number or any number or
identification mark shall immediately notify the Chief of Police. (Ord. 2277,
3-7-88)
3-9-5: FENCES AND ADVERTISEMENTS:
   A.   Fence Requirements: An automobile salvage shall be entirely enclosed by
a fence eight feet (8') in height which shall be kept neatly painted and in
good repair at all times and which shall be constructed of plank board or
corrugated iron so as to exclude such yard from public view. No inoperable
motor vehicle or parts thereof shall be permitted to remain outside the fenced
area. A period of fifteen (15) days from the effective date hereof is allowed
the operators of such yards to construct the fence or fences required by this
Chapter.
   B.   Advertisements on Fences: The fence enclosing an automobile salvage
shall not be used for bill-postings or other advertising purposes.
   C.   Contents Not to Exceed Above Fence Height: The contents of an
automobile salvage yard shall not be placed or deposited to a height greater
than the height of the fence surrounding it, excluding equipment used in the
operation of the salvage yard. (Ord. 2277, 3-7-88)
3-9-6: SANITARY AND SAFETY REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Removal of Rubbish and Waste: An automobile salvage yard shall, as far
as practicable, be kept clear and clean of all rubbish or waste matter.
   B.   Open Fires: No open fire for the burning of rubbish, trash,
automobiles, or any parts thereof, or other waste matters, shall be permitted.
   C.   Gasoline to be Drained From Vehicles: All tanks and engines shall be
kept thoroughly drained of gasoline and fluids which shall be disposed of in an
environmentally safe method.
   D.   Fire Extinguishers: Each auto salvage yard shall have on hand at least
one fire extinguisher of a type recommended by the manufacturer to put out
gasoline fires and fires in automobiles. Such fire extinguisher shall be in
plain sight in an easily accessible location and shall be kept charged. Each
employee shall be informed of the location of the fire extinguisher and of the
manufacturer's instructions for using it. (Ord. 2277, 3-7-88)
3-9-7: INSPECTIONS:
All automobile salvage yards, together with the books required by this Chapter,
shall be, at all times, open for inspection to all officers of the City having
police power and the Health and Building Officer. (Ord. 2277, 3-7-88)
3-9-8: PENALTY:
Any person violating any provision of this Chapter shall, for each offense, be
punished as provided in Section
 1-4-1 of this Code. (1993 Code)
CHAPTER 10
JUNK YARDS
SECTION:
3-10-1: Definition
3-10-2: License Required
3-10-3: Application for License; Fee
3-10-4: Nuisance Conditions Prohibited
3-10-5: Revocation of License
3-10-6: Penalty
3-10-1: DEFINITION:
A "junk yard" is hereby defined as a plot of ground which may be covered with
buildings, partly covered with buildings or without any buildings, which plot
is used for the buying, selling, storing and trading of old iron, rags, hides,
furs, old furniture, rubber, wool, junked car parts, 1  old metals, bottles and
the like, commonly called junk. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. II, §2)
 
Notes
1 1. See also Chapter 9 of this Title.
3-10-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to operate a junk yard anywhere in the City
without first securing a license therefor. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. II, §1)
3-10-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE:
Any person desiring a license for a junk yard shall make application, in
writing, to the City Clerk. Such application shall state the name and address
of the applicant and the address of the proposed junk yard. Such application
shall be referred by the Clerk to the City Council, and no permit shall be
issued until after approval of the City Council. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. II,
§3)
The annual fee for such licenses shall be two hundred dollars ($200.00). (1979
Code Ch. 14, Art. II, §4)
3-10-4: NUISANCE CONDITIONS PROHIBITED:
It shall be unlawful for any person licensed hereunder to permit any premises
used by him to become a nuisance by virtue of unhealthful conditions, piling of
articles or lumber, fire hazards or any other dangerous condition. (1979 Code
Ch. 14, Art. II, §5)
3-10-5: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
In addition to the penalty provided, the Mayor may revoke any junk yard license
for any violation of this Chapter or any ordinance of the City applicable
thereto. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. II, §6)
3-10-6: PENALTY:
Any person violating any provisions of this Chapter shall, for each offense, be
punished as provided in Section
1-4-1 of this Code. (1993 Code)
CHAPTER 11
SCAVENGERS AND USE OF ROLL-OFF CONTAINERS 1
SECTION:
3-11-1: Definitions
3-11-2: Scavenger License Required
3-11-3: Scavenger License Fees
3-11-4: Insurance Required
3-11-5: Schedule Of Scavenger Rates
3-11-6: Conditions Of Scavenger License
3-11-7: Inspection Of Scavenger And Roll-Off Container Vehicles Required
3-11-8: Roll-Off Container Permit Required And Conditions Of Permit
3-11-9: Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 4, chapter 3 of this code.
3-11-1: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this chapter, the following terms or words used herein shall
be interpreted and construed as follows:
   GARBAGE: Shall mean and include any and all trash, refuse, waste, ashes,
rubbish, debris, junk, scrap, recycling materials, construction waste, or
garbage of any kind, nature, or extent whatsoever or items of a similar nature.
   PERSON: Shall mean and include any firm, entity, partnership, association,
organization, or any other group acting as a unit, corporation, as well as any
natural person; provided, however, "person" shall not include the city or its
employees, officials, or officers while acting in the course of their
employment or office of the city.
   ROLL-OFF CONTAINER: Shall mean and include any receptacle with a capacity of
two (2) cubic yards or more that is designed for the purpose to collect
quantities of garbage.
   ROLL-OFF CONTAINER VEHICLE: Shall mean and include any vehicle designed for
the purpose of transporting any roll-off container, but shall not include any
scavenger vehicle.
   SCAVENGER, SCAVENGERS OR SCAVENGER BUSINESS: Shall mean and include any
person engaged in the business, within the city, of the collection and/or
removal and/or disposal of garbage and/or the providing of any roll-off
containers for the collection of garbage.
   SCAVENGER VEHICLE: Shall mean and include any vehicle designed for the
purpose for collecting and/or compacting and/or removing and/or disposing of
garbage incident to a scavenger business. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
3-11-2: SCAVENGER LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in a scavenger business within
the city over the city's streets, alleyways, roadways, or other public ways
without first obtaining a scavenger license in the manner set forth in this
chapter from the city. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
3-11-3: SCAVENGER LICENSE FEES:
   A.   Fees Established: The license fee for a scavenger's license for each
twelve (12) month period shall be an amount determined by the sum of one
hundred dollars ($100.00) for each scavenger vehicle and/or roll-off container
vehicle to be used by a scavenger in the scavenger business during each twelve
(12) month period.
   B.   Payment Of Fees: All scavenger license fees shall be payable to the
city clerk. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
3-11-4: INSURANCE REQUIRED:
Each scavenger shall maintain, throughout the entire term of the scavenger's
license issued hereunder, liability insurance, with a reputable insurance
company authorized to do business in the state of Illinois, in an amount of not
less than one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) per person and three
hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00) per occurrence and such insurance shall
specifically name the city as an additional named insured. Such insurance shall
provide liability protection on an "occurrence basis", and not a "claims made
basis", incident to the operation of such scavenger business and the operation
and/or use of each scavenger vehicle and/or roll-off container vehicle used or
provided by such scavenger in such scavenger business. At the time of
application for a scavenger license, and from time to time thereafter upon
request of the city clerk, each scavenger shall provide the city clerk with a
certificate of insurance evidencing such insurance coverage for the entire term
of the scavenger's license. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
3-11-5: SCHEDULE OF SCAVENGER RATES:
Each scavenger shall, at each time a scavenger license is issued to the
scavenger and immediately following any rate change, file with the city clerk,
a schedule of rates to be charged to the scavenger's customers. (Ord. 3124, 5-
19-2003)
3-11-6: CONDITIONS OF SCAVENGER LICENSE:
   A.   Sunday Hours: It shall be unlawful for any person to operate or drive
any scavenger vehicle or roll-off container vehicle on, through, or over any
city streets, alleyways, roadways, or other public ways prior to twelve o'clock
(12:00) noon on any Sunday.
   B.   Disposal Or Storage Restrictions: It shall be unlawful for any
scavenger to dispose of or store any garbage within the city limits.
   C.   Parking Restrictions: It shall be unlawful for any person to park any
scavenger vehicle or any roll-off container vehicle at any time within the city
limits when such scavenger vehicle or roll-off container vehicle is not
actually then being used and operated in the course of a scavenger business.
   D.   Limited Capacity Of Scavenger Vehicles: It shall be unlawful for any
person to drive or operate or use any scavenger vehicle within the city that
has a "packer capacity" (as that term is generally and customarily used in the
scavenger business) for the collection of garbage, in excess of twenty five
(25) cubic yards. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
3-11-7: INSPECTION OF SCAVENGER AND ROLL-OFF CONTAINER VEHICLES REQUIRED:
The city clerk, before issuing a scavenger license, shall require the scavenger
to obtain the written approval of the city health and building officer to the
effect that each scavenger vehicle and/or roll-off container vehicle has been
inspected by such officer and found to be satisfactorily constructed to prevent
the littering of garbage onto the city's streets, alleyways, roadways, or other
public ways and that each scavenger vehicle has a "packer capacity" (as that
term is generally and customarily used in the scavenger business) for the
collection of garbage of twenty five (25) cubic yards or less. (Ord. 3124, 5-
19-2003)
3-11-8: ROLL-OFF CONTAINER PERMIT REQUIRED AND CONDITIONS OF PERMIT:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any person to locate, place, use, or maintain
any roll-off container on any city street, alleyway, roadway, sidewalk, or
other public way without first obtaining a roll-off container permit from the
city. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
   B.   The fee for each roll-off container permit shall be twenty five dollars
($25.00) for each roll-off container located, placed, used, or maintained at
each general location for each period of time of thirty (30) days or less. An
additional fee of twenty five dollars ($25.00) shall be required for each
additional period of time of thirty (30) days or less at the same or nearby
location. (Ord. 3372, 2-19-2008)
   C.   A roll-off container permit shall not be issued until after the city
street and sewer superintendent approves of the intended location of each roll-
off container on such city street, alleyway, roadway, sidewalk, or other public
way and has inspected such roll-off container and indicates to the city clerk
that such roll-off container(s) and the intended location thereof meet(s) the
requirements of this chapter.
   D.   Each roll-off container must have affixed thereon reflectors on all
four (4) corners of each roll-off container and at a height that would be
within the direct headlight beam of vehicles that may approach such roll-off
container.
   E.   The name, address, and twenty four (24) hour phone number of the
scavenger who owns each roll-off container must be clearly and visibly marked
on such roll-off container in reflective letters and numbers.
   F.   No roll-off container permit shall be issued unless a scavenger who
holds a current scavenger license issued by the city is providing such roll-off
container.
   G.   A roll-off container permit may be denied issuance upon the
recommendation of the city street and sewer superintendent if such roll-off
container has a garbage collection capacity of more than twenty (20) cubic
yards.
   H.   It shall be unlawful for any person to locate, place, use, or maintain
any roll-off container on any city street, alleyway, roadway, sidewalk, or
other public way unless such roll-off container is protected by lighted
barricades placed in the front and the rear of the roll-off container and the
sides of the roll- off container facing vehicular and/or pedestrian traffic
have reflective tape of at least two inches (2") in width vertically affixed to
such side(s) of the roll-off container.
   I.   It shall be unlawful for any person to locate, place, use, or maintain
any roll-off container on any street, alleyway, roadway, sidewalk, or other
public way that will interfere with vehicular traffic or that reduces the
usable vehicular width of such street, alleyway, roadway, or other vehicular
public way to less than eighteen feet (18').
   J.   It shall be unlawful for any person to deposit or store any materials
or garbage on any street, alleyway, roadway, sidewalk, or other public way
other than in a roll-off container for which a roll-off container permit has
been issued under this chapter.
   K.   With or without a roll-off container permit having been issued under
this chapter, it shall be unlawful for any person to use any city sidewalk
during the alteration, repair, improvement, or construction of any building or
structure unless such sidewalk is protected by a temporary roof whenever danger
from falling objects is present and unless such sidewalk is covered to protect
such sidewalk from mortar, paint, etc., or any other construction materials of
any kind, nature, or extent whatsoever. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
3-11-9: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the terms or provisions of this chapter shall be
fined, upon conviction, an amount of not less than two hundred fifty dollars
($250.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each offense.
Each day upon which a violation occurs or continues shall be deemed a separate
offense. A violation hereof may be established by a preponderance of the
evidence. (Ord. 3124, 5-19-2003)
CHAPTER 12
TAXICAB DRIVERS
SECTION:
3-12-1: Definitions
3-12-2: License Required; Fee
3-12-3: Restrictions on Issuance of License
3-12-4: Requirements for the Operation of Taxicabs and Taxicab Companies
3-12-5: Suspension or Revocation of License
3-12-6: Penalty
3-12-1: DEFINITIONS:
For purposes of this Chapter 12, the following definitions shall apply and
control:
TAXICAB: A motor vehicle of any kind, nature or extent whatsoever that carries
passengers for a fare usually determined by the distance traveled or the
location selected.
TAXICAB COMPANY: Shall mean and include any sole proprietorship, partnership,
limited liability company or partnership, or corporation or any other company
or entity of any kind, nature or extent whatsoever that operates a taxicab
business with owned or non-owned taxicabs. Such "taxicab company" shall also
include any taxicab driver who owns the taxicab he or she drives or operates,
and any company operated under the names of "Uber" or "Lyft".
TAXICAB DRIVER: Shall mean and include any person whose occupation or job is to
take people in a taxicab to the place they want to go in return for money. Such
"taxicab driver" shall also include, but is not limited to, any taxicab driver
who is hired as an employee or is an independent contractor of the company or
entity that owns or operates the taxicab service business and owns the taxicab
the taxicab driver is to drive or operate. (Ord. 3935, 12-2-2019)
3-12-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE:
   A.   No taxicab company shall operate any taxicab business in the City
without having first secured a taxicab company license and paid the annual
license fee of one-hundred dollars ($100.00) per taxicab operated by the
taxicab company. Each issued taxicab company license shall be for a period not
exceeding three hundred sixty-five (365) calendar days and shall expire at 12
midnight (12:00 a.m.) on December 31 of each year. Such annual taxicab company
license fee shall be paid in full and shall not be subject to proration
regardless of the date of issuance of such taxicab company license.
   B.   No taxicab driver shall drive any taxicab without having first secured
a taxicab driver license and paid the annual license fee of twenty-five dollars
($25.00) therefor. Each issued taxicab driver license shall be for a period not
exceeding three hundred sixty-five (365) calendar days and shall expire at 12
midnight (12:00 a.m.) on December 31 of each year. The twenty-five dollar
($25.00) annual taxicab driver license fee shall be paid in full and shall not
be subject to proration regardless of the date of issuance of such taxicab
driver license. (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. VIII, §§ 1.2; amd. Ord. 3935, 12-2-
2019)
3-12-3: RESTRICTIONS ON ISSUANCE OF LICENSE:
The Taylorville Police Department shall annually conduct a criminal and local
history check or inquiry on each applicant for a taxicab company license or for
a taxicab driver license.
No such license shall be issued or renewed to any taxicab driver:
   A.   Who does not hold a valid Illinois driver's livery license to operate a
taxicab; or
   B.   Who is a registered sex offender; or
   C.   Who fails to provide evidence that the person has filed the requisite
proof of financial responsibility as required by the State of Illinois (see 625
ILCS 5/8-101). (1979 Code Ch. 14, Art. VIII, §3; amd. Ord. 3935, 12-2-2019)
3-12-4: REQUIREMENTS FOR THE OPERATION OF TAXICABS AND TAXICAB COMPANIES:
   A.   The taxicab driver's picture, the taxicab driver's license or
registration number, and the taxicab medallion number or an exterior
identification number must be posted in a visible location in each taxicab.
   B.   There must be posted in a visible location in each taxicab a telephone
number for a passenger to call if the taxicab driver is operating the taxicab
in a reckless manner.
   C.   If a taxicab driver collides with a pedestrian while operating a
taxicab, resulting in bodily injury, then any responding law enforcement
officers must test the taxi driver for drug and alcohol use.
   D.   A taxicab company shall not hire or employ any taxicab driver who is a
registered sex offender. It is the sole responsibility and obligation of a
taxicab company to investigate, determine, and advise the Chief of Police if
any of its taxicab drivers are registered sex offenders.
   E.   A taxicab company shall not allow any taxicab driver to drive or
operate a taxicab after the taxicab driver is or becomes a registered sex
offender. It is the sole responsibility and obligation of a taxicab company to
investigate, determine, and advise the Chief of Police if any of its taxicab
drivers become registered sex offenders. (Ord. 3935, 12-2-2019)
3-12-5: SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
The Mayor or the Chief of Police may suspend or revoke any taxicab company
license and/or any taxicab driver's license for any one or more of the
following offenses:
   A.   A taxicab driver who violates any State of Illinois statute or City
Code provisions regulating the conduct of drivers of motor vehicles; or
   B.   A taxicab driver who operates or drives a taxicab while in possession
of or while consuming or while under the influence of alcohol, marijuana, or of
any illegal drugs or contraband or any combination thereof; or
   C.   A taxicab driver who sells, gives, distributes, or delivers alcoholic
liquor to any person who is under the age of twenty-one (21) years or to any
intoxicated person or to any person known by the taxicab driver to be of legal
disability or in need of mental treatment; or
   D.   A taxicab driver who sells, gives, distributes, transports, or delivers
any illegal drug or contraband to or for any person; or
   E.   A taxicab driver who operated or drove a taxicab without holding a
valid Illinois driver's livery license to operate a taxicab; or
   F.   A taxicab driver is or becomes a registered sex offender; or
   G.   A taxicab driver who fails to provide evidence that such person has
filed and maintained the requisite proof of financial responsibility as
required by the State of Illinois (see 625 ILCS 5/8-101).
   H.   A taxicab company who fails to investigate, determine, and advise the
Chief of Police that any of its taxicab drivers is or becomes a registered sex
offender.
   I.   A taxicab company or a taxicab driver who fails to satisfy any of the
applicable requirements of Section
3-12-4 of this Chapter 12.
   J.   A taxicab driver who fails to submit to a drug and alcohol test as
required by paragraph (c) of Section
3-12-4 of this Chapter 12. (Ord. 2291, 6-6-88; amd. Ord. 3935, 12-2-2019)
3-12-6: PENALTY:
In addition to the suspension or revocation of any taxicab driver's license or
taxicab company license, and not in lieu thereof, any taxicab driver and/or
taxicab company violating any provision of this Chapter 12 shall, for each
offense, be punished and fined as provided in Section
1-4-1 of this City Code; provided, however, and notwithstanding the two hundred
fifty dollars ($250.00) minimum fine provision of said Section
1-4-1, a minimum fine of Five Hundred Dollars ($500.00) shall be assessed for
each offense committed by a taxicab company. (1993 Code; amd. Ord. 3935, 12-2-
2019)
CHAPTER 13
GOING OUT OF BUSINESS SALES
SECTION:
3-13-1: License Required
3-13-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
Any person or entity having a "going out of business sale" must first make
application to the city clerk for a license and obtain such license and pay a
seventy five dollar ($75.00) fee for each issuance of such license or renewal
thereof in accordance with 815 Illinois Compiled Statutes 350/1 et seq., of the
Illinois statutes and as may be amended from time to time in the future. (Ord.
3743, 3-21-2016)
CHAPTER 14
ADULT USE LICENSING AND REGULATION
SECTION:
3-14-1: Purpose
3-14-2: Definitions
3-14-3: License Required
3-14-4: Issuance Of License
3-14-5: Liquor
3-14-6: Fees
3-14-7: Inspection
3-14-8: Expiration Of License
3-14-9: Suspension
3-14-10: Revocation
3-14-11: Hearing; Judicial Review
3-14-12: Transfer Of License
3-14-13: Business Records
3-14-14: Liquor License
3-14-15: Adult Entertainment Cabarets; Restrictions
3-14-16: Video Viewing Booths; Restrictions
3-14-17: Hours Of Operation
3-14-18: Law Enforcement Access
3-14-1: PURPOSE:
The purpose of this chapter is to regulate adult uses to protect the community
from the many types of criminal activity frequently associated with such uses.
The city recognizes that such regulation cannot effectively prohibit such uses,
but can balance the competing interest of the community in reducing criminal
activity and protecting property values versus the protected rights of the
owners, operators, employees and patrons of adult uses. (Ord. 3205, 11-15-2004)
3-14-2: DEFINITIONS:
   ADULT BOOKSTORE: An establishment having as a substantial or significant
portion of its sales or stock in trade, books, magazines, films for sale or for
viewing on premises by use of motion picture devices or by coin operated means,
and periodicals which are distinguished or characterized by their emphasis on
matter depicting, describing or relating to "specified sexual activities", or
"specified anatomical areas", or an establishment with a segment or section
devoted to the sale or display of such materials, or an establishment that
holds itself out to the public as a purveyor of such materials based upon its
signage, advertising, displays, actual sales, presence of video preview or coin
operated booths, exclusion of minors from the establishment's premises or any
other factors showing the establishment's primary purpose is to purvey such
material.
   ADULT ENTERTAINMENT CABARET: A public or private establishment which
regularly features: a) persons who appear in a state of nudity; or b) live
performances which are characterized by the exposure of "specified anatomical
areas" or by "specified sexual activities"; or c) films, motion pictures,
videocassettes, slides or other photographic or computer reproductions which
are characterized by the depictions or descriptions of "specified sexual
activities" or "specified anatomical areas".
   ADULT MOTION PICTURE THEATER: A building or area used for presenting
materials distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on matter depicting,
describing or relating to "specified sexual activities" or "specified
anatomical areas" for observation by patrons therein.
   ADULT NOVELTY STORE: An establishment having a substantial or significant
portion of its sales or stock in trade consisting of toys, devices, clothing
"novelties", lotions and other items distinguished or characterized by their
emphasis on or use for "specified sexual activities" or "specified anatomical
areas" or an establishment that holds itself out to the public as a purveyor of
such materials based upon its signage, advertising, displays, actual sales,
exclusion of minors from the establishment's premises or any other factors
showing the establishment's primary purpose is to purvey such material.
   ADULT USE: Adult bookstores, adult motion picture theaters, adult
entertainment cabarets, adult clubs allowing nudity at regular or frequent
times, adult novelty stores and other similar uses.
   EMPLOYEE: Means and includes employees, independent contractors or any other
person who is retained by the licensee or subject to dismissal from working at
the licensed premises.
   ESTABLISHED OR ESTABLISHMENT: Means and includes any of the following:
   A.   The opening or commencement of any sexually oriented business as a new
business;
   B.   The conversion of an existing business, whether or not a sexually
oriented business, to any sexually oriented business;
   C.   The addition of any sexually oriented business to any other existing
sexually oriented business; or
   D.   The relocation of any sexually oriented business.
   LICENSEE: A person in whose name a license to operate a sexually oriented
business has been issued, as well as the individual or individuals listed as an
applicant on the application for a sexually oriented business license.
   NUDITY, OR STATE OF NUDITY: Means and includes the showing of the human male
or female genitals, pubic area, female breasts with less than a full opaque
covering below a point immediately above the top of the areola, human male
genitals in a discernibly turgid state even if completely and opaquely covered
or, that portion of the buttocks which would be covered by a properly worn
"thong" type bikini bottom.
   OPERATE OR CAUSES TO BE OPERATED: To cause to function or to put or keep in
operation.
   OPERATOR: Means and includes any person on the premises of a sexually
oriented business who is authorized to exercise overall operational control of
the business, or who causes to function or who puts or keeps in operation the
business. A person may be found to be operating or causing to be operated a
sexually oriented business whether or not that person is an owner, part owner,
or licensee of the business.
   PERSON: Means and includes any individual, proprietorship, partnership,
corporation, association, or other legal entity.
   PUBLIC PLACE: Means and includes any location frequented by the public, or
where the public is present or likely to be present, or where a person may
reasonably be expected to be observed by members of the public. Public places
include, but are not limited to, streets, sidewalks, parks, beaches, business
and commercial establishments (whether for profit or not for profit and whether
open to the public at large or where entrance is limited by a cover charge or
membership requirement), hotels, motels, restaurants, nightclubs, country
clubs, cabarets, and meeting facilities utilized by social, fraternal or
similar organizations. Premises used solely as a private residence, whether
permanent or temporary in nature, shall not be deemed a public place. Public
places shall not include enclosed single sex public restrooms, enclosed single
sex functional showers, locker and/or dressing room facilities, enclosed motel
rooms and hotel rooms designed and intended for sleeping accommodations,
doctors' offices, churches, synagogues or similar places when used for
circumcisions, baptisms or similar religious ceremonies, portions of hospitals
and similar places in which nudity or exposure is necessarily and customarily
expected outside of the home; nor shall it include a person appearing in a
state of nudity in a modeling class operated by a proprietary school licensed
by the state or by a college, junior college or university supported entirely
or partly by taxation, or by a private college or university which maintains
and operates educational programs in which credits are transferable to a
college, junior college or a university supported entirely or partly by
taxation or an accredited private college.
   SEMINUDE: Means and includes a state of dress in which clothing covers no
more than the genitals, pubic region, and areola of the female breast, as well
as portions of the body covered by supporting straps or devices.
   SEXUALLY ORIENTED BUSINESS: A business that includes an adult use.
   SPECIFIED ANATOMICAL AREAS: Means and includes:
   A.   Less than completely and opaquely covered: 1) human genitals, 2) pubic
region, 3) buttocks, 4) anus, 5) female breasts below a point immediately above
the top of the areola; and
   B.   Human male genitals in a discernibly turgid state, even if completely
and opaquely covered.
   SPECIFIED CRIMINAL ACTIVITY: Means and includes any of the following
offenses:
   A.   Prostitution or promotion of prostitution; dissemination of obscenity;
sale, distribution or display of harmful material to a minor; sexual
performance by a minor; possession or distribution of child pornography; public
lewdness; public indecency; indecency with a child; engaged in organized
criminal activity; sexual assault; molestation of a child; gambling;
distribution of a controlled substance; or any similar offenses to those
described above under the criminal or penal code of the state of Illinois or
other states or countries;
   B.   For which: 1) less than two (2) years have elapsed since the date of
conviction or the date of release from confinement imposed for the conviction,
whichever is the later date, if the conviction is of a misdemeanor offense; or
2) less than five (5) years have elapsed since the date of conviction or the
date of release from confinement for conviction, whichever is the later date,
if the conviction is a felony offense; or 3) less than five (5) years have
elapsed since the date of the last conviction or the date of release from
confinement from the last conviction, whichever is the later date, if the
convictions are of two (2) or more misdemeanor offenses or combination of
misdemeanor offenses occurred within any twenty four (24) month period; and
   C.   The fact that a conviction is being appealed shall have no effect on
the disqualification of the applicant.
   SPECIFIED SEXUAL ACTIVITIES: For the purposes of this chapter, "specified
sexual activity" means and includes: a) human genitals in the state of sexual
stimulation or arousal; b) human masturbation, sexual intercourse, sodomy, oral
copulation, artificial or simulated; c) fondling or other erotic touching of
human genitals, pubic region, buttocks, anus or female breasts; and d)
excretory functions as part of or in connection with any activities set forth
in this definition.
   TRANSFER OF OWNERSHIP OR CONTROL OF A SEXUALLY ORIENTED BUSINESS: Means and
includes any of the following:
   A.   The sale, lease, or sublease of the business;
   B.   The transfer of securities which constitute a controlling interest in
the business, whether by sale, exchange, or similar means; or
   C.   The establishment of a trust, gift, or other similar legal device which
transfers the ownership or control of the business, except for transfer by
bequest or other operation of law upon the death of the person possessing the
ownership or control. (Ord. 3205, 11-15-2004)
3-14-3: LICENSE REQUIRED:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any person to operate an adult use without a
valid adult use business license issued by the city pursuant to this chapter;
or to employ a person who is not licensed as an adult use employee as provided
by subsection B of this section or who is not authorized to work or perform
services pursuant to subsection C of this section.
   B.   Except as provided in subsection C of this section, it shall be
unlawful for any person to be an employee of a sexually oriented business
without a valid license. The provisions of this subsection shall not apply to
an employee of an adult bookstore, unless such bookstore is operated in
combination with one or more of the following businesses as defined herein:
"adult entertainment cabaret", "adult motion picture theater" and "adult
novelty store".
   C.   An applicant, upon receipt by the city clerk of his or her application
for a sexually oriented business employee license, may work or perform services
without an employee license until such time as the license is granted or the
decision to deny the license becomes final pursuant to section 3-14-11 of this
chapter. Upon receipt of the applicant's completed application for an employee
license, the city clerk shall issue the applicant a temporary work permit. The
applicant shall keep the temporary work permit on his or her person or on the
premises where the applicant is then working or performing services, and
produce such permit for inspection upon request by a law enforcement officer or
other authorized city official.
   D.   All applicants must be qualified according to the provisions of this
chapter. The application may request and the applicant shall provide such
information (including fingerprints) as is needed to enable the city to
determine whether the applicant meets the qualifications established in this
chapter.
   E.   An applicant for a sexually oriented business license or a sexually
oriented business employee license shall file in person at the office of the
city clerk an application made on a form prescribed and provided by the city.
The applicant must be determined to be qualified according to the provisions of
this chapter. The application shall be signed under oath by the applicant and
notarized. If a person who wishes to operate an adult use is an individual, the
person must sign the application for a license as applicant, and must file the
application in person at the city clerk's office. If the applicant is a club,
consisting of private or public membership, then such entity must also be
licensed under this chapter. If a person who wishes to operate an adult use is
other than an individual or club, each individual who has a twenty percent
(20%) or greater interest in the business, including corporations, must sign
the application for a license as applicant. Each applicant must be qualified
under the following section and each applicant shall be considered a licensee
if the license is granted.
   F.   The completed application for an adult use business license shall
include, but not be limited to, the following information:
      1.   If the applicant is an individual, the individual shall state his/
her legal name and any other names used in the last five (5) years, submit
proof that he/she is eighteen (18) years of age, and the current residential
mailing address and telephone number.
      2.   If the applicant is a club, consisting of private or public
membership, a copy of the bylaws of the club must be submitted with the
application. In addition, a sworn statement as to the purposes, general
activities and requirement for a club membership must be submitted.
      3.   A partnership, the partnership shall state its complete name and the
names of all partners, whether the partnership is general or limited, and a
copy of the partnership agreement, if any.
      4.   A corporation, the corporation shall state its complete name, the
date of incorporation, evidence that the corporation is in good standing under
the laws of its state of incorporation, the names and capacities of all
officers, directors and principal shareholders (those with a 20 percent or more
stake), and the name and address of the registered corporate agent.
      5.   The adult use name, business location, business mailing address and
telephone number.
      6.   If the applicant intends to operate the adult use business under a
name other than that of the application, he/she must state: a) the business'
fictitious name and b) submit any required registration documents.
      7.   Whether the applicant has been convicted of any "specified criminal
activity" as defined in this chapter, and if so, the specified criminal
activity involved, the date, place and jurisdiction of each.
      8.   A photograph of the applicant and two (2) sets of the applicant's
complete fingerprints. The photograph and fingerprints, if not taken at the
office of the city's chief of police, shall be taken within the preceding one
month by a law enforcement agency and accompanied by a notarized verification
by that agency.
      9.   Whether the applicant has had a previous license under this chapter
or similar laws or ordinances in another jurisdiction denied, suspended or
revoked, including the name and location of the business for which the permit
was denied, suspended or revoked, as well as the date of the denial, suspension
or revocation. If the applicant has been a partner in a partnership or an
officer, director or principal stockholder of a corporation that is or was
licensed under this chapter or similar laws or ordinances in another
jurisdiction and a license has previously been denied, suspended or revoked,
include the name and location of the business for which the permit was denied,
suspended or revoked, as well as the date of denial, suspension or revocation.
      10.   Whether the applicant holds any other licenses under this chapter
or other similar laws or ordinances in another jurisdiction and if so, the
names and locations of such other licensed businesses.
      11.   A sketch or diagram showing the configuration of the premises,
including a statement of total floor area occupied by the business. This sketch
or diagram need not be professionally prepared, but it must be drawn to a
designated scale or drawn with marked dimensions of the interior of the
premises.
   G.   The information provided pursuant to subsections F1 through F11 of this
section shall be supplemented in writing by certified mail, return receipt
requested, to the city clerk within ten (10) working days of a change of
circumstances which would render the information originally submitted false or
incomplete.
   H.   The information provided by an applicant in connection with the
application for a license under this chapter shall be maintained by the city
clerk on a confidential basis, except that such information may be disclosed to
other governmental agencies in connection with a law enforcement or public
safety function or pursuant to any requirement under the Illinois freedom of
information act. (Ord. 3205, 11-15-2004)
3-14-4: ISSUANCE OF LICENSE:
   A.   Within thirty (30) days after receipt of a completed adult use business
license application, the city council shall approve or deny the issuance of a
license to an applicant. The city council shall approve the issuance of a
license unless it determines, by a preponderance of the evidence, any one or
more of the following:
      1.   The applicant is under eighteen (18) years of age;
      2.   The applicant is overdue in payment to the city of taxes, fees,
fines or penalties assessed against or imposed upon him/her/it in relation to
any business;
      3.   The applicant has failed to provide information reasonably necessary
for the issuance of the license or has falsely answered a question or request
for information on the application form.
      4.   The applicant has been denied a license by the city to operate an
adult use business within the preceding twelve (12) months or whose license to
operate an adult use business has been revoked within the preceding twelve (12)
months.
      5.   The applicant has been convicted of a "specified criminal activity"
as defined in this chapter.
      6.   The premises to be used for adult use business has not been
inspected and approved by the city's fire chief and the city's health and
building officer as being in compliance with applicable laws and ordinances.
      7.   The license fee required by this chapter has not been paid.
      8.   The applicant of the proposed establishment is in violation or is
not in compliance with all of the provisions of this chapter.
   B.   The license, if granted, shall state on its face the name of the person
or persons to whom it is granted, the number of the license issued to that
applicant, the expiration date, and, if the license is for an adult use
business, the address of the adult use business. An adult use business employee
license shall contain a photograph of the licensee. The adult use business
license shall be posted in a conspicuous place at or near the entrance to the
adult use business so that it may be easily read at any time. An adult use
business employee shall keep the employee's license on his or her person or on
the premises where the licensee is then working or performing, and shall
produce such a license for inspection upon request by a law enforcement officer
or other authorized city official.
   C.   The city's fire chief and the city's health and building officer shall
complete their inspection certification that the premises is in compliance or
not in compliance with this code within twenty (20) days of receipt of the
application by the city.
   D.   No adult use business license shall be issued unless it meets all
